title: Hull 2017 UK City of Culture live: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: live updates from hull 's year as uk city of culture .
this page is updated with stories , videos and more as they are made .
scroll back down the page to see what 's happened so far in 2017 .

documents.title: goole film to premiere tonight
text: almost 50 people from goole will feature in a new film about the town which is having its premiere tonight .
goole 's mp andrew percy and the chair of east riding of yorkshire council , caroline fox , will be among the guests at the invitation-only screening at the town 's lowther hotel .
the film has been funded with a grant linked to the hull city of culture 2017 programme .
its first public screenings will be in the new year .
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: replica of amy johnson plane to move
text: replica of amy johnson plane to move

documents.title: air museum move for amy johnson replica plane in hull
text: a replica of a plane flown by the first woman to fly solo from britain to australia is to be moved from hull 's paragon station to an air museum in north yorkshire .
the plane was created by inmates at hull prison earlier this year to honour amy johnson , who was born in the city and who completed her historic flight from london to darwin in 19 days in 1930 .
the ministry of justice says the replica is to be moved to the yorkshire air museum in elvington , north yorkshire , as there is no suitable location within hull due to the plane 's size .
the ministry says it 's `` delighted '' the plane , which was built to celebrate hull city of culture 2017 , has found a permanent home alongside other amy johnson exhibits at the aviation museum .
despite this , leonard brown , who designed the replica plane , says he 's disappointed it 's leaving hull :
i had the pleasure on thursday to meet her majesty the queen and show her the plane and speak to her about it , which was fantastic .
now we find out that it 's not ours and it 's going .
i am not pleased . ''
author: Anne-Marie Tasker
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: could brexit have an impact in hull 's freedom festival ?
text: brexit could have an impact on hull 's annual freedom festival , that 's according to the executive director .
this year saw 200 performances involving artists from over 25 countries .
jenny howard-coombes , the executive director of freedom festival , says eu grants could be lost and they could struggle to get performers from other countries .
we 're always looking beyond the shores of the uk .
we are an international partnership .
so we have to consider the business impact this will have on things like travel and what does it mean for the freedom of artists .
there 's lots of unknowns ''
author: Anne-Marie Tasker
BBC Look North

documents.title: comedy culture tickets go on sale
text: tickets are now on sale for hull truck theatre 's 2018 season , including `` the culture '' , a comedy all about hull uk city of culture 2017 !
author: Hull 2017: UK City of Culture

documents.title: weekly guide to what 's on - 23rd november

documents.title: giant projection to transform landmark
text: giant projection to transform landmark

documents.title: giant projection to transform the deep aquarium
text: a giant light and sound projection is to transform one of hull 's landmarks into an innovative art installation .
images of icebergs will be shown on the side of the deep aquarium for three nights starting 8 december .
titled floe , the installation is among the final major commissions marking hull 's year as uk city of culture .
artists anna heinrich and leon palmer said they wanted to `` virtually reshape and remodel the architectural façade '' .

we want to create a sense of drama and depth using projection , light and sound when we delved into sir terry farrell 's vision and conceptual approach to designing the building , we uncovered various images and ideas that sparked our imagination .
the deep was designed by architect sir terry farrell and opened in 2002 .
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

documents.title: sadiq khan thinks london can learn from hull
text: sadiq khan thinks london can learn from hull

documents.title: four years since hull won uk city of culture 2017
text: exactly four years ago today it was announced hull would become uk city of culture 2017 .
it beat leicester , dundee and swansea bay to the right to hold the title in 2017 .
the uk government chooses a new destination every four years , with the aim of helping tourism and the economy .
since the announcement , have you seen a change in hull ?
email us and let us know .
author: Hull 2017: UK City of Culture

documents.title: where hull goes london follows !
text: the london mayor sadiq khan has been visiting hull today to see what ideas he can take from the city of culture .
he 's been impressed with how the arts and performances have been accessible for everyone .
he says he 's hoping to implement a similar idea in different london boroughs .

the visit is to mark hull 's year as city of culture .

text: if you go in one of hull 's pubs between now and christmas you might notice some special beer mats on the tables .
they 'll feature taken by the winners of a photography competition , which was part of the city of culture year .
sixteen will be featured , which show scenes including hull fair and the uk pride event .

documents.title: hull 's old town is booming
text: hull 's old town has changed dramatically since hull was announced as the city of culture four years ago .
the area has seen millions of pounds worth of investment and the council has created a grant scheme to help people get their new ventures off the ground .
work done by us here at bbc radio humberside shows more than 50 new businesses , which were n't around in 2013 , now call the city 's historic heart their home .
that does n't include figures on which businesses have closed .
we 've certainly seen a huge interest in lots of space being taken in the old town , food and beverage , retail and office space as well .
dozens and dozens of new businesses have been opening up . ''
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: works begins on last hull city of culture art installation commission
text: a major artwork involving interactive robots is to end the year-long city of culture celebrations in hull .
more than 20 robotic arms , each with lights , mirrors , prisms and speakers , are being installed at beverley gate , trinity square and in the old town area .
it is the last in a series of big temporary commissions marking hull 's year as uk city of culture .
called where do we go from here ? , the large metal structures are due to go on display on 1 december .
they are being fitted on three-metre tall plinths and have been created by jason bruges studio , which was behind the aeolian tower show in london and the sunderland station light art project .
where do we go from here ?
runs until 7 january 2018 .
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

text: 'stunning ' light show for city of culture

documents.title: hull 's giant puppet parade attracts thousands
text: thousands of people lined the streets of hull on saturday night for the latest big city of culture event .
the 'land of green ginger unleashed ' performance featured gigantic animals and mythical creatures - the parade made it 's way through the city centre .
author: Kate Sweeting
Reporter, BBC Look North

documents.title: finale of the mysterious land of green ginger
text: giant puppets and street performers will be marching through the streets of hull tomorrow as they mark the finale of a major city of culture event .
more than 50,000 people have turned out to watch previous parts of the land of green ginger which have been performed so far this year .
the parade will start at 18:30 tomorrow at saville street and weave along guildhall road , lowgate and high street before finishing at humber street at around 21:00 .
but as you can expect with a parade , there 'll also be road closures .
saville street is closed from today until 21:00 tomorrow , but you can still get to the shops .
guildhall road is also closed today until 21:00 tomorrow .
the rest of the road closures are starting tomorrow and you can find them on the city of culture website .
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : here 's kofi with what 's on in hull this week

documents.title: one chance left to sway city of culture judges
text: sunderland 's city of culture 2021 bid team spent yesterday giving the judges a whirlwind tour of wearside - and now they have just one more chance to impress .
next month they 'll make one last push for victory with a presentation in the current city of culture , hull .
head judge , tv producer phil redmond of grange hill , brookside and hollyoaks fame , said hull has `` raised the bar for whoever follows '' .
sunderland is up against coventry , stoke , paisley and swansea .
author: Colin Briggs
Look North

documents.title: 'wear the one ' : sunderland prepares for city of culture visit
text: as we told you earlier , city of culture 2021 judges are in sunderland today and the echo newspaper and website is throwing its weight behind the bid .
they 've produced an `` ultimate guide '' to wearside with must-see locations and local phrases - among them `` canny '' , `` gannin '' , `` marra '' and `` hoy '' .
sunderland is up against swansea , coventry , paisley and stoke-on-trent for the accolade .
hull is the current title holder .
author: Sunderland Echo
Newspaper

documents.title: 'mackem dictionary ' for city of culture judges
text: today 's another big day for sunderland as it bids to be crowned city of culture 2021 .
four members of the judging panel are touring the city - led by tv producer and creator of hollyoaks and grange hill , phil redmond .
sunderland is one of five cities in contention for the prize .
bid organisers have even equipped each of the judges with a `` mackem dictionary '' as a tongue-in-cheek reference tool to translate the local dialect .
author: Colin Briggs
Look North

documents.title: culture 'used as continuation of conflict '
text: culture 'used as continuation of conflict '
author: Robbie Meredith
BBC News NI Education Correspondent

documents.title: the 'turnip ' prize launches in hull
text: an art award which commends bad art work will take place in hull for the first time next month .
the 'turnip prize ' is a spoof of the prestigious turner art prize , which is currently on show at the ferens art gallery .
the organiser of the spoof award hopes it will be just as big a hit .
the turnip prize was launched in a pub down south in 1999 , as a satire on the turner prize .
it 's been running ever since .
it 's a popular thing , where people produce rubbish works of art .
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: ferens art gallery puts young art fans in spotlight
text: hull 's ferens gallery , which is hosting this year 's turner prize , is to hold a special late night event to attract more younger people to the venue .
the turner//return event is due to take place on thursday 16 november and will see the gallery transformed into a live music venue with workshops and film screenings .
there will also be pop-up dance performances throughout the gallery and free tours for people aged between 18 and 25 who want to learn more about the ferens .
in its first month , the turner prize has had more than 45,000 visitors proving the interest that people in this city , and beyond , have in art .
we hope turner//return will also bring new audiences into the ferens and encourage them not to make the visit their last . ''
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: watch : a song for hull
text: a song for hull , made up of poems written by primary school children across the city , will be performed for the first time this evening .

about 240 children from eight schools will be joined by local rapper nineties boy , the garnett family who were on britain 's got talent , the nhs choir for hull and east yorkshire and the x factor 's g4 star jonathan ansell , for the performance at hull city hall .
here 's a clip of the song :

documents.title: hull tourist tax ?
text: hull city council say no decision has been made about a proposed tourist tax in the city .
the idea was mentioned in a council meeting today and would mean tourists visiting the city would have to pay an added cost to stay in hotels .
the council are looking at other cities to assess if the idea would work here and they say the idea would have to be discussed with other relevant parties before anything would be implemented .
they stress that no decision has been made and all final decisions would be made by the council 's cabinet .

documents.title: coventry hosts city of culture judges
text: city of culture judges have been hosted by the team behind coventry 's bid to take the 2021 title .
the judges were taken to a number of venues , meeting community groups as well as city leaders .
a flavour of the atmosphere as 150 people shared lunch with @ twitterid judges .
they 'll decide if @ twitterid wins uk city of culture .
good luck the party looks great !
welcoming the judges into coventry in style !
# thisiscoventry
hope they enjoy our great city # thisiscoventry - jo # covhour
expect victory coventry , evc , a good old coventry registration number .
beautiful

documents.title: government art collection to go on show in hull
text: a collection of works by renowned artists normally seen in government buildings and embassies are to go on display in hull .
grayson perry , martin creed , david shrigley and cornelia parker are among the artists whose works will be on show at hull university 's brynmor jones library from tomorrow .

the eyeful of wry works are from the government art collection and features 46 pieces based on british political satire , including cartoons from the 18th and 19th centuries by james gillray and william heath , as well as paintings , prints and video by other contemporary artists .
it also includes a new commissioned video piece by artist peter liversidge featuring the comedian phill jupitus , which is going on show for the first time .
i 'm pleased that hull as our uk city of culture 2017 will host this exhibition , giving us the opportunity to open up the government art collection to new audiences .
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

text: kofi goes back to the future

documents.title: watch : the fight for city of culture comes to coventry
text: will coventry be the next uk city of culture ?
judges are visiting the city as it vies with stoke-on-trent , paisley , swansea and sunderland to take on the title in 2021 .
members of positive youth foundation from the city explain why they think it 's got a good chance .
author: Martin Winch
BBC News

documents.title: the city speaks
text: the city speaks

documents.title: stoke says 'ay up duck ' to culture judges
text: city of culture judges are on their tour of the six towns that make up stoke-on-trent .
toy ducks are being handed out at locations around the city - a reference to the stoke greeting `` ay up duck '' .
the six-person panel has been meeting the bid team at the spode works on elenora street .
stoke-on-trent is vying with paisley , coventry , sunderland and swansea for the title , with the winning bid announced in december .
author: Lee Thomas
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: hull school children 's art bricks available for collection
text: anyone who wants to keep one of the 16,000 bricks made by school children in hull for a city of culture exhibition should go along to the c4di building at 13:00 on sunday 5 november .
you may remember yesterday we told you about a campaign to save the bricks as some people were concerned they 'd be destroyed after the exhibition but now people are being allowed to take them home .
the bricks will be allocated at random and there 'll be two further times and dates when people can collect them which city of culture will confirm on their facebook and twitter pages .

documents.title: city of culture judges in stoke-on-trent
text: a national award for ceramics and a £ 52m investment in the arts have been announced as part of stoke-on-trent 's bid to become the uk city of culture 2021 .
judges are visiting the spode museum heritage centre , where they 'll be shown the largest collection of blue-transfer pieces .
stoke is up against coventry , sunderland , swansea and paisley for the title .

documents.title: campaign to save bricks made by school children in hull
text: a campaign has been set up to save 16,000 bricks made by schoolchildren in hull for a city of culture exhibition .
children at more than 150 nursery schools and children 's centres across the city were given the chance to personalise their own brick .
they 're currently on display at the c4di building but there are fears they could be destroyed once the exhibition is finished .
parents are now calling for the bricks to be saved .

carla coyle , who has set up a facebook page called `` save our 16,000 '' said , `` we believe they should be built into a wall or something that can remain forever to show the children that they can grow up and make an impact on this city . ''
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: can the buddies punch above their weight ?
text: can the buddies punch above their weight ?

BBC Scotland special correspondent

documents.title: watch : hull 2017 single aims for chart success
text: a song all about hull has been released this morning , recorded by hundreds of children and a few famous faces .
the single , called 'culture clash : song for hull ' , features g4 's jonathan ansell and the garnett family , who were on britain 's got talent last year .
the lyrics were inspired by hundreds of poems written by primary school children in hull .
here 's the official video :
the song will be performed at a special concert at hull city hall on friday 20 november .
author: Suzy Lawson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : 'hull , a portrait of a city ' .
text: two world renowned artists who have photographed royalty and some of the most famous names in showbiz have turned their attention to hull .
martin parr and olivia arthur have taken of people from all walks of life for an exhibition called 'hull , portrait of a city ' .
people who posed for the photos have been giving their reaction to seeing their faces up on the gallery wall .
author: Jo Makel
BBC Look North

documents.title: roll-up , roll-up , the circus is in town !
text: people in care homes in hull are getting the chance to take part in circus workshops :
members of the upswing theatre group are visiting six homes as part of city of culture 2017 .
residents are taking part in workshops before performing in a circus show .
looks like fun !

documents.title: watch : looking for ideas for the week ahead ?
text: kofi smiles , bbc face of hull 2017 , has everything you need to know to get cultured as part of hull city of culture :
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'a sight to behold '
text: it 's bright , it 's bold and it 's designed to be touched .
it 's a new sculpture at the hull and east yorkshire eye hospital .
'a sight to behold ' has been designed by artist jemma brown for people who are visually impaired .
it 's part of hull 's city of culture and was inspired by a visit to the yorkshire sculpture park .
hull and east riding institute for the blind helped with the organisation and there 's a collection point next to it for old glasses which will be donated to jabcob 's well appeal .
it 's great to know that the appreciation which visually impaired people have for the arts has not been overlooked in this city of culture year .

many of our patients have been involved in research work to influence the design of the sculpture , which will now be displayed within hull and east yorkshire eye hospital for patients , staff and visitors to enjoy .
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: if you made a puppet of yourself , what would it look like ?
text: if you made a puppet of yourself , what would it look like ?

documents.title: 'unique ' sculpture to be unveiled at hull eye hospitals
text: a new sculpture exploring the experiences of visually impaired people is to be unveiled at the hull and east yorkshire eye hospital .
the artwork , a sight to behold , has been created by artist jemma brown after working with visually impaired people from across the region .
the main focus for the project was for participants to explore their experiences as a visually impaired individual .
the artwork was created after a visit to the yorkshire sculpture park , as well as a series of workshops where participants explored memories , hobbies and individual conditions .

it has been a really positive experience for all concerned , allowing visually impaired people across the region to develop new skills , share experiences , form new friendships and collectively develop a unique piece of art . ''
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: artwork marks efforts of hull city of culture 2017 volunteers
text: hull 's city of culture 2017 volunteers are to be celebrated in an artwork set to be exhibited in the city early next year .
anglo-american artist julia vogl has been commissioned to produce the artwork and will take up residency in the city during november and december .
hull 2017 organisers say the piece will be `` experimental and engaging '' and will reflect the diversity and unity of the city of culture volunteers .
the artist is described as someone who `` engages and empowers communities through vibrant and celebratory visual art '' .
here 's some of her work :

documents.title: award-winning art studio to create 'light installation ' in hull
text: hull 's old town is set to host a major city of culture 2017 art display at the end of the year .
the display , known as where do we go from here ? , is described as a `` robotic light installation '' made up of light , shadow and sound to guide people through the old town .
the exhibition will fun from 1 december to 7 january 2018 and has been created by award-winning london-based art collective jason bruges studio .

documents.title: exhibition celebrates 60 years of couples tying the knot on hull estate
text: an exhibition showing six decades of couples getting married on a hull estate opens today .
as part of hull 's city of culture 2017 celebrations , people living on the greatfield estate will be displaying their wedding dresses and photographs .
the exhibit will be at st stephen 's neighbourhood centre on the estate .
we want local children to see how their parents and grandparents got married , often with very little money .
greatfield brides and grooms will bring our local stories to life by putting the spotlight on that special day . ''

documents.title: second round bid for sunderland city of culture 2021
text: sunderland has submitted its second round bid today to become city of culture 2021 .
the bid documents will be sent to the department of culture , media and sport outlining in detail what the city has to offer on the cultural front and why it deserves to win .
campaigners behind sunderland 's bid to become city of culture say `` winning will transform sunderland - and bring in millions of pounds of investment '' .
wishing my wonderful home town all the luck in the world in the bid for # sunderland2021
fingers crossed

documents.title: watch : coventry 's culture bid delivered
text: the team behind coventry 's bid to bring the coveted title to the city , the coventry city of culture trust , have delivered a 30-page document to the department for digital , culture , media and sport .
it includes a wide-reaching programme that would ensure that the whole of the city gets the opportunity to experience and enjoy a wide range of cultural events , say bid organisers .
coventry is up against paisley , stoke-on-trent , sunderland and swansea for the title - the decision will be made in december .

documents.title: remembering hull 's headscarf revolutionaries
text: a new mural is being unveiled on hessle road in hull today to remember those who fought for the safety of trawlermen .
lillian bilocca , christine jensen , mary denness and yvonne blenkinsop led a campaign after three ships sank in 1968 with the loss of 58 lives .
three hull trawlers - st romanus , kingston peridot and ross cleveland - all sank in quick succession .
only one man survived .

the four women , who were dubbed the headscarf revolutionaries and lived in hull 's fishing community of hessle road , gathered a 10,000-signature petition calling for reform after the triple trawler tragedy .
the women forced new safety measures to be brought in after lobbying the government .
author: Sally Fairfax
BBC Radio Humberside Live

documents.title: culture bid taken to edge of space
text: a copy of the stoke-on-trent bid to become city of culture has been taken to the edge of space by students from staffordshire and keele universities .
a branded duck and bid logo were also successful in being launched into the stratosphere using a weather balloon
bid organisers say the event celebrates the city 's creative industries and technological offer , both of which are important parts of the bid .
thanks to the clever bods @ twitterid & @ twitterid for helping to send our # cityofculture2021 bid and the # sot2021 duck off into space
sometimes you need a few boffins on the team @ twitterid : ) .

coventry is up against stoke-on-trent , sunderland , swansea and paisley for the title .
a panel of judges will visit all cities next month , with the winner being announced in december .

the four-day spoken word festival will celebrate both new and existing work , packed with world premieres , concerts and events as part of city of culture 2017 .
poets from all over the world will be performing right here in hull .

documents.title: watch : 20-year plan for a cultural legacy for hull
text: the company behind hull 's year as uk city of culture says it 's going to continue working in the city for the next 20 years .

it aims to make culture part of educating every child in the city - and that until it hands on the city of culture title in 2021 , it will set up new festivals and art installations - and bring more arts funding to the city .
author: Anne-Marie Tasker
BBC Look North

documents.title: picture : a flock of mosaic birds
text: a flock of 100 mosaic birds will appear at hull paragon station later .
the artwork took six months to make and is called 'fly to freedom . '
it 'll be in place for a year .
author: Amanda White
BBC East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: 'flood ' performance returns to hull
text: an epic city of culture performance staged on the water in a hull dock returns to the city tonight .
flood , which tells the story of the impact on individuals and communities when their city is destroyed , is helping to mark the fourth season of 2017 .
it first appeared as an online film in january , followed by a live performance in april , and a tv screening in august .
the fourth set of performances starts tonight until the 29 september , with more between the 4 and 8 october .
author: Hull 2017: UK City of Culture

documents.title: the culture exhibition taking flight at hull 's paragon station
text: a huge flock of more than 100 mosaic birds are set to take flight in hull paragon station .
the artwork is a six-month project that has seen 26 artists join dozens of residents from hull , the east riding and lincolnshire to create the installation .
the installation , fly to freedom , starts tomorrow and will stay at the railway station for the next year .

as a group of northern artists , and as a resident of hull myself , we are really proud to have the opportunity to be part of hull uk city of culture 2017 and work with the community including children with disabilities , adults with hearing impairments , families and the general public
author: Hull 2017: UK City of Culture

documents.title: watch : high turnout for the turner prize show
text: hundreds of visitors have been in hull to see the turner prize show in the first hour of the exhibition being open .
the ferens art gallery has already welcomed record numbers of visitors this year and it 's thought this prestigious art prize will attract more people than ever before .
author: Jill Archbold
BBC Look North

documents.title: turner prize : exhibition dates released
text: the turner prize will be presented at the ferens art gallery in hull for the first time .
the gallery is housing an exhibition of work by this year 's shortlisted artists : hurvin anderson , andrea büttner , lubaina himid and rosalind nashashibi ( all below ) .
the exhibition will run 26 september 2017 to 7 january 2018 , and will be a highlight of hull uk city of culture 2017 .
the winner will be announced on tuesday 5 december 2017 at an award ceremony in hull .
author: Anne-Marie Tasker
BBC Look North

documents.title: turner prize shortlisted artists : lubaina himid
text: as the turner prize edges ever closer to opening its doors at ferens art gallery in hull , we 're taking a look at the four artists who have been shortlisted for this year 's prize .
the turner prize is a world renowned art prize awarded by the tate to an artist who 's exhibited outstanding work in the previous year .
so far we 've heard from hurvin anderson and andrea buttner and today we 'll hear from lubaina himid .
we 've still to hear from rosalind nashashibi before the exhibition opens on tuesday 26 september .
the winner of this year 's turner prize will be announced at the end of december .
meet lubaina , turner prize 2017 shortlisted artist .
26 sep 2017 - 7 jan 2018 @ twitterid / / # turnerprize / @ twitterid
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: art for art 's sake in hull
text: work is under way on the latest city of culture art installation in hull .
sixteen huge steel columns will be arranged in a grid in front of hull minster and people will be able to go inside the exhibit called 'a hall for hull ' .
the artwork is the latest in a series that included the blade which was in queen victoria square at the start of the year .
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: culture city wins enterprising award
text: culture city wins enterprising award

documents.title: culture city wins enterprising gong
text: hull has been crowned the most enterprising place in britain by the government for its `` economic growth '' .
the current uk city of culture won two categories in the department for business , energy & industrial strategy 's enterprising britain awards .
it was praised for its investment in education and training programmes and its ventures in renewable energy , including siemens ' £ 310m wind turbine blade factory .
judges acknowledged the city had `` 5,000 more jobs and 6,800 more people in employment now compared to 2011 '' .
i want to congratulate the city of hull for their enormous success .
they are a fantastic example of what can be achieved by applying an innovative approach to supporting businesses , and i wish them continued success .
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

documents.title: renowned album sleeves exhibition honours hull photographer
text: renowned album sleeves produced by a hull-born photographer have gone on display in the city .
mike oldfield 's tubular bells record cover was among a crop created by photographer trevor key .
he also worked with artists jamie reid on the sex pistols releases and with factory records designer peter saville on new order 's sleeves including technique and true faith .
a selection of key 's artwork is being shown at the hull school of art and design .

titled trevor key 's top 40 , the exhibition also features sleeves he designed for omd ( orchestral manoeuvres in the dark ) , german bands can and tangerine dream , as well as comedy duo peter cook and dudley moore 's derek and clive act .
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

documents.title: countdown to the turner prize
text: just six days to go until the turner prize exhibition opens at hull 's ferens art gallery .
the four shortlisted artists ( will exhibit their work here in hull from 26 september until december when the winner will be announced .
the turner prize is renowned throughout the world and is given to an artist who 's exhibited outstanding work the year before .
the four nominees are hurvin anderson , andrea buttner , lubaina himid and rosalind nashashibi .
here 's a preview of hurvin anderson 's work :
meet hurvin , turner prize 2017 shortlisted artist .

documents.title: major roadworks suspended for hull fair
text: major roadworks on newland avenue in hull will be suspended next month to allow access to hull fair .
newland avenue is currently being resurfaced and the council says the work is ahead of schedule .
the decision 's been made to temporarily reopen the road for two weeks from monday , 2 october .
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: hull wont 'drop the ball ' on securing culture legacy
text: the chair of hull city of culture says they wo n't drop the ball on ensuring the year leaves a legacy .
rosie millard told bbc radio humberside they 're raising funds to ensure 2017 continues to have an impact .
she says hull 2017 has created a positive feeling in the city :
it has been just remarkable .
the figures for public engagement have been astonishing .
the joy in the city , you can feel it .
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017
